title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 2576/85 of 12 September 1985 amending Regulation (EEC) No 685/69 as regards the time limits for payment for butter bought in by intervention agencies
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 2576/85
of 12 September 1985
amending Regulation (EEC) No 685/69 as regards the time limits for payment for butter bought in by intervention agencies
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN
COMMUNITIES
main_body:
The following subparagraphs are hereby added to Article 5 (5) of Regulation (EEC) No 685/69:
'During the 1985/86 marketing year Member States shall be entitled to pay for butter manufactured from deliveries by small milk producers, and bought in by intervention agencies, from the 60th day after it is taken over.
Member States which make use of this entitlement shall communicate in good time to the Commission the steps which they envisage taking in order to apply the measure.'

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 12 September 1985.
For the Commission
Frans ANDRIESSEN
